I would recommend "The River Why" (1983) for those interested in a romantic drama set against the backdrop of fly-fishing.

The movie follows the story of a young man who abandons his family for a solitary life of fly-fishing. His goal was to find his own way in the fishing world and thereby find himself and love. 

The River Why" is directed by Richard Jenkins, and stars Ebon Moss- Bachrach, William Devane, Dallas Roberts, Kathleen Quinlan, William Hurt.

I hope this recommendation is helpful to you.

conversation.text: I would recommend "Drive" as a gripping drama that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The movie is directed by Nicolas Winding Refn and stars Ryan Gosling, who delivers an excellent performance in the role of Joe. Joe's job is to drive a used car for people who don't have a car themselves. However, things take a turn when Joe starts to make connections between the people he drives cars for and other people who are involved in various criminal activities.
